summary: An email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York to an FBI contact regarding outstanding subpoena returns in the Epstein investigation. The email lists subpoenas served in July and August 2019 on state corporate divisions in Albany, Delaware, and the US Virgin Islands, and requests follow-up to obtain the documents.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Author of the email, requesting follow-up on outstanding subpoena returns related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: paralegal
persons.context: Mentioned as a point of contact to set up a file-sharing portal if subpoena returns are too large to email.

connections.person1: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The prosecutor references their paralegal as a colleague who can assist with technical file-sharing logistics.

keyFacts: The document is a 2020 email from a federal prosecutor following up on subpoenas issued in 2019 as part of the Epstein investigation.
Subpoenas targeted corporate registration divisions in Albany, the US Virgin Islands (twice), and Delaware, suggesting an investigation into corporate entities linked to Epstein.
The prosecutor indicates the subpoena returns were due to the FBI but had not been received, prompting a request for follow-up.
The correspondence demonstrates ongoing investigative activity into Epstein's network well after his 2019 arrest.
